name: Paneer Butter Masala
description: A delicious paneer butter masala made with vegan paneer and packed full of delicious herbs and spices. Vegan and gluten free recipe.
recipeIngredient: 2 cups vegan paneer cubes (find the recipe for vegan paneer in my cookbook )
1/2 teaspoon coriander seeds or coriander powder
6  medium sized cloves of garlic chopped
1 Tablespoon dried Kasuri Methi. Fresh Fenugreek Leaves can also be used. (optional)
1 cup cashews soaked in water for an hour
1/2 cup non dairy milk or thin cashew cream
chopped cilantro or grated beets for garnish

recipeInstructions.text: In a large pan, add oil and chopped onions and let cook on medium heat for 10 minutes or until the onions start to look nice and golden.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large pan, add oil and chopped onions and let cook on medium heat for 10 minutes or until the onions start to look nice and golden.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the spices( bay leaves, cumin, coriander, turmeric, methi seeds, cloves, cinnamon, cardamom and red chili) and cook for 2-3 minutes. You can roast these spices separately before hand and keep them to be added at blending time as well.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the spices( bay leaves, cumin, coriander, turmeric, methi seeds, cloves, cinnamon, cardamom and red chili) and cook for 2-3 minutes. You can roast these spices separately before hand and keep them to be added at blending time as well.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the green Serrano chili and garlic and ginger and cook for another 5 minutes with occasional stirring.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the green Serrano chili and garlic and ginger and cook for another 5 minutes with occasional stirring.

recipeInstructions.text: Cool the mixture a little and blend the onion spices mixture along with chopped tomatoes and soaked cashews.
recipeInstructions.name: Cool the mixture a little and blend the onion spices mixture along with chopped tomatoes and soaked cashews.

recipeInstructions.text: In the same pan, add the butter and pour the blended mixture and kasuri methi or fresh chopped methi leaves, and cook on medium low heat partially covered for 20-30 minutes occasionally stirring on until the mixture thickens and starts to leave oil on the sides.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the salt sugar, milk or cream and vegan paneer cubes and mix well. If the consistency of the sauce is too thick, add some more non dairy milk. You can use water instead as well.

recipeInstructions.text: Cook on medium-low heat, covered for 5 minutes. Taste and adjust salt and sugar. This dish is usually quite sweet in restaurants.

recipeInstructions.text: Garnish with fresh chopped cilantro or grated beets or fried onions!

recipeInstructions.text: Serve hot with Naan, Roti or Basmati Rice.
